main event: An object fell from the sky in Chengtu, China in 1947. It was silver in color, rectangular in shape, and had English inscriptions on it. The object was 10 inches in length, about five inches in width, and approximately one inch thick. It contained four small batteries and two radio transmitter tubes, along with a piece of white paper on the bottom.
interesting points: The sighting was reported by S. Elliott of the 5th Air Force Weather
The object had English inscriptions, indicating a possible human origin
The presence of batteries and radio transmitter tubes raises questions about the object's purpose
The specific dimensions of the object were provided, adding detail to the report
The lack of photographs despite the object being described in detail
sighted object: silver, rectangular object with English inscriptions
witnesses: S. Elliott of the 5th Air Force Weather
